titleStmt.title: SII 13.83: original edition by G.V. Srinivasa Rao
No. 83. (A.R. No. 211 of 1906.) PĒRAṄGIYŪR, TIRUKKOYILUR TALUK, SOUTH ARCOT DISTRICT. ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE, RUINED ŚIVA TEMPLE.

summary.p: This inscription registers the remission of the taxes due on some land endowed for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Mūlasthānam-uḍaiya-Paramasvāmi at Pēriṅgūr, by Agniśarma Daśapuri-Bhaṭṭa-Sōmayājiyār of Puḷḷalūr, a member of the Āḷuṅgaṇam of the village, who paid a lump-sum of money therefor to the assembly (Peruṅguṟi-Perumakkaḷ). The alphabet of the inscription looks like that of No. 210 of 1906 of the time of Rējēndra-Chōḷa I, and the details of the date, viz. 4th year, Mithuna, śu. 7, Thursday, Hastā agree for A.D. 989, June 13, when Hastā commenced at ·25 of day. The record is therefore one of Rājarāja I.
